gobblin.source

Class DatePartitionedNestedRetriever

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.source.DatePartitionedNestedRetriever
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PartitionAwareFileRetriever

    public class DatePartitionedNestedRetriever
extends Object
implements PartitionAwareFileRetriever
    PartitionRetriever that is optimized for nested directory structures where data is dumped on a regular basis and most data has likely been processed by Gobblin already. For example, if ConfigurationKeys.SOURCE_FILEBASED_DATA_DIRECTORY is set to /my/data/, then the class assumes folders following the pattern /my/data/daily/[year]/[month]/[day] are present. It will iterate through all the data under these folders starting from the date specified by #DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_MIN_WATERMARK_VALUE until either #DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_MAX_FILES_PER_JOB files have been processed, or until there is no more data to process. For example, if #DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_MIN_WATERMARK_VALUE is set to 2015/01/01, then the job will read from the folder /my/data/daily/2015/01/01/, /my/data/daily/2015/01/02/, /my/data/2015/01/03/ etc.

      • getFilesToProcess

        public List<PartitionAwareFileRetriever.FileInfo> getFilesToProcess(long minWatermark,
                                                                    int maxFilesToReturn)
                                                             throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PartitionAwareFileRetriever
        Return a list of files to process that have a watermark later than minWatermark. Generally, a FileRetriever should find each valid partition after minWatermark, sorted by ascending time. For each partition: 1. Add all files in the partition 2. If the # of files in the return list is now greater than maxFilesToReturn, return immediately 3. Else continue to next partition until there are none left maxFilesToReturn is a soft cap - all files in a partition should be returned by getFilesToProcess().
        Specified by:
        getFilesToProcess in interface PartitionAwareFileRetriever
        Throws:
        IOException
